alert.note: Alert for Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Marin Coastal Range; North Bay Interior Mountains; Sonoma Coastal Range (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 20 at 2:01PM PST until January 21 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore, Marin Coastal Range, North Bay Interior Mountains, North Bay Interior Valleys and Sonoma Coastal Range. * WHEN...From Sunday evening through Monday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rises in creeks and streams likely with this additional round of rain coming through late Sunday into Monday morning. Flood-prone areas such as the Mark West Creek near Mirabel Heights and the Green Valley Creek near Forestville will likely see minor flooding impacts. Additionally, coastal mountains could see locally higher rain rates with this system. Given that soils along hillslopes are saturated, there is an increased risk of widespread, shallow landslides. - Check out http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

area.areaDesc: Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; Marin Coastal Range; North Bay Interior Mountains; Sonoma Coastal Range
